LS polls: Congress eyes win in 6 seats which BJP never lost since formation of Chhattisgarh

In Rajnandagon Lok Sabha seat, the BJP never tasted defeat since 2000 but in a 2007 bypoll, the Congress emerged victorious. This time, the Congress has fielded former chief minister Bhupesh Baghel from Rajnandgaon.

31 Mar, 2024, 01:01 PM IST

2018 defamation case: Hearing postponed to March 13 as Rahul cites busy schedule

The court hearing in the 2018 defamation case against Rahul Gandhi, over his alleged objectionable remarks targeting Home Minister Amit Shah, was postponed to March 13 as Gandhi's counsel sought more time due to his involvement in the Bharat Jodo Nyay Yatra. Santosh Pandey, the advocate of complainant Vijay Mishra, opposed the request for additional time.

02 Mar, 2024, 06:18 PM IST

Madhya Pradesh Election 2023 Winner List: Landslide win for BJP as Congress falls by the wayside

Madhya Pradesh Assembly Election 2023 Full Winner List: The state recorded a high turnout rate of 76.22 percent in 2023, crossing the last election's voting numbers of 74.97 percent. Over 5.59 lakh voters were eligible to cast their votes in this election.

03 Dec, 2023, 11:56 PM IST

Nine assembly seats where BJP yet to taste victory since formation of Chhattisgarh

After Chhattisgarh was carved out of Madhya Pradesh, the BJP won three consecutive assembly elections in the state in 2003, 2008 and 2013, bagging 50, 50 and 49 seats, respectively. In 2018, the Congress stopped the march of the Raman Singh government by winning 68 seats in the 90-member assembly. BJP's tally plunged to 15.

27 Oct, 2023, 03:12 PM IST

Madhya Pradesh traffic police establishes 310 km green corridor from Jabalpur to Bhopal for organ transportation

Madhya Pradesh traffic police have successfully established a green corridor spanning 310 kilometers to facilitate organ transportation within the state. The corridor connected Metro Hospital Jabalpur to Bansal Hospital in Bhopal. Due to technical issues, the decision was made to transport the organ by road instead of airlifting it. The traffic arrangements for the journey were meticulously coordinated, with Jabalpur Traffic Police ensuring a smooth passage until the border of Jabalpur.

22 Sep, 2023, 02:06 PM IST

Bikru Killing of Cops: 23 of Dubey gang sentenced to 10 years in jail

A special Gangster Act court has sentenced 23 individuals to 10 years in prison in connection with the Bikru massacre of 2020, where eight policemen were killed. Among those convicted is Jaykant or Jay Bajpayee, a businessman who was known to be the key financier for gangster Vikas Dubey.

06 Sep, 2023, 12:25 AM IST

Won't tolerate alleged 'attacks' on migrants: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav

Bihar Deputy Chief Minister Tejashwi Yadav on Sunday said that both Bihar and Tamil Nadu governments will not tolerate alleged 'attacks' on migrants labourers and urged the Centre to take steps to resolve the matter.

Roger Binny to replace Ganguly as BCCI president, Jay Shah will continue as secretary, says BCCI sources

Roger Binny, the 1983 World Cup champion for India, will succeed Sourav Ganguly as BCCI President at the Board's annual meeting on October 18. Ganguly held the role for three years.

Sourav Ganguly unlikely to keep BCCI president role; speculation strong for Roger Binny as replacement

He has been named in the BCCI draft electoral rolls ahead of the elections in India's cricket governing body.
